160 units of family consultation per State fiscal year;
A total of $2,104 for environmental accessibility adaptations over a 36-month period;
32 units of intensive individual support services per day;
80 units of adult life planning services per State fiscal year, for participants 14 years old or older;
16 units of adult life planning services per date of service, for participants 14 years old or older; and

15 units of retainer payment per calendar year at either the regular or intensive level when the participant is absent from the residential habilitation program for the purposes of family visitation, hospitalization, or other overnight stays.
Respite services may not be reimbursed for the same period of the same day as:
Residential habilitation;
Intensive individual support services;
Family consultation;
Therapeutic integration;
Intensive therapeutic integration; or
Adult life planning services.
The Program does not reimburse transportation costs such as gas, maintenance, or other vehicle operating expenses.
Adult life planning services under this chapter and school health-related services under COMAR 10.09.50 may not be reimbursed for the same period of the day.

The Program does not reimburse for any autism waiver services for a participant whose residential placement in a 24-hour, 365-day residential program is funded with non-Medicaid federal, State, or local government funds.
Request for Payment.
An approved provider shall submit requests for payment for the services covered under this chapter according to the procedures set forth in COMAR 10.09.36.04 or otherwise established by the Program.
The provider shall:
Bill the Program in accordance with the payment methodology specified in §§D and E of this regulation;
Accept payment from the Program as payment in full for the services covered under this chapter and make no additional charge to the participant or any other party for these services; and
Submit a request for payment in a manner approved by the Program, which includes the:
Date or dates of service;
Participant's name and Medicaid number;
Provider's name, location, and Program identification number;
Type, procedure code or codes, and unit or units of covered services provided; and
Amount of reimbursement requested.
Documentation Required.

Payments by the Program or its designee may be withheld if the provider fails to submit requested evidence of services provided, staff qualifications, corrective action plans, or other types of documentation related to ensuring the health and safety of a participant.
Payments shall be released upon receipt and approval by the Program or its designee of the requested documentation.
An appeal by the provider under COMAR 10.01.03 does not stay the withholding of payments.
Billing time limitations for the services covered under this chapter are the same as those set forth in COMAR 10.09.36.06.
Payments.
Payments shall be made only to a qualified provider for services covered under this chapter which are rendered to a participant.
Providers shall be paid the lesser of:
The provider's customary charge to the general public unless the service is free to individuals not covered by Medicaid; or
The rate established according to the fee schedule published by the Department.
Rates.
The Department shall publish a fee schedule for services covered under this chapter that shall be publicly available and updated at least annually or upon any changes made by the Department.
Subject to the limitations of the State budget, the Program’s rates as specified in this regulation shall increase by 4 percent each year through Fiscal Year 2026.
Effective July 1, 2022, the Program shall pay according to the following fee-for-service schedule:
Residential habilitation services and retainer payments reimbursed at one of the following all-inclusive, maximum rates for a participant:
$283.69 per unit for the regular level of service; or
$567.45 per unit for the intensive level of service.
Therapeutic integration services reimbursed at the maximum rate of $17.19 per unit.
Intensive therapeutic integration services reimbursed at the maximum rate of $21.49 per unit.
Intensive individual support services reimbursed at the maximum rate of $21.49 per unit.
Respite care reimbursed at the maximum rate of $16.80 per unit.
Family consultation reimbursed at the maximum rates of $70.55 per unit.
Adult life planning services reimbursed at the maximum rate of $70.55 per unit.
Environmental accessibility adaptations reimbursed at the maximum rate of $2,104 per 36-month period amount billed by the provider, which shall be the lesser of the:
Amount authorized by the State Department of Education; or
Actual cost of the job.
Effective July 1, 2023, the Program shall pay according to the following fee-for-service schedule:
Residential habilitation services and retainer payments reimbursed at one of the following all-inclusive, maximum rates for a participant:

Amount authorized by the State Department of Education; or

section.heading: Recovery and Reimbursement.
section.text: Recovery and reimbursement are set forth in COMAR 10.09.36.07 and include, but are not limited to:

para.text: Providing waiver services without a valid required license or appropriate credentials as required;
Employing staff or consultants that do not meet conditions for participation in accordance with Regulation .04 of this chapter to provide services to waiver participants;
Lacking adequate documentation of services that were billed to the Program;
Submitting claims for services not authorized in the participant's plan of care; and
Providing services that are not in accordance with the requirements of this chapter and other applicable regulations and law.

section.heading: Cause for Suspension or Removal and Imposition of Sanctions.

para.text: Cause for suspension or removal and imposition of sanctions is set forth in COMAR 10.09.36.08.
In addition to the sanctions specified at COMAR 10.09.36.08, the Department may limit:
The number of participants served by the provider; and
The number and type of services provided.

section.heading: Appeal Procedures for Providers.
section.text: Appeal procedures for providers are those set forth in COMAR 10.09.36.09.

section.heading: Appeal Procedures for Applicants and Participants.
section.text: Appeal procedures for applicants and participants are those set forth in COMAR 10.09.24.13 and 10.01.04.

section.heading: Interpretive Regulation.
section.text: State regulations are interpreted as set forth in COMAR 10.09.36.10.
